TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Tundra Exploration - v7.0 (Nov 5th, 2023) - (Re)Stockalike SpaceX Falcon 9, (Crew) Dragon (XL) & Haven-1!

Articles.Content:
16 hours ago, RichieLH271 said:

Hey Damon!

I love Tundra, the models you have are absolutely fantastic and I'm looking forward for what's to come.

I've been having an issue recently though where every time I descend from Apogee in Gojira Mk4 (SN8) I have no drag keeping me at a constant speed of ~70m/s, so my craft breaks up on descent. 
I do use a Tweakscale version to 9m diameter but I haven't had any issues previously.
This issue has only been appearing recently for me though, and I do add extra parts now to make it look more realistic.

If you have any idea what's up then please let me know how to resolve the issue, and if you do need any more info, then do ask.

Once again, I absolutely love the mod. I appreciate what you've done.
Thanks,
RichieLH271
 

 

My descent looks like this (ignore TU being weird) - https://imgur.com/MW9qTo1

how about you first try descent with an un scaled version without the extra parts and then if that works you can add the extra parts back and finally tweakscale it back to 9m to troubleshoot. I'm just not sure if these parts where supposed to work with tweakscale so just keep that in mind.
Hey so I downloaded the mod yesterday with textures unlimited, but the Starship still wasn’t shiny. Is there a special way I have to install or do to textures unlimited to get it to work?
Well this latest Update is a bit special , like the options for the Test Version and the landing legs , excellent update thanks .

21 hours ago, DasBear1 said:

Hey so I downloaded the mod yesterday with textures unlimited, but the Starship still wasn’t shiny. Is there a special way I have to install or do to textures unlimited to get it to work?

You need to enable reflections in KSP graphics settings. When you start up KSP, go to settings. Go to the Graphics tab. Set 'reflection refresh' to something other than 0.

@damonvvShould the FAQ/Known Issues part in the OP be updated? Because this is a very frequently asked question, and it seems clear that the vague 'be sure to turn on shaders in KSP settings' can be confusing.

Edited March 14, 2021 by OrdinaryKerman
Summoned damonvv since at least one person agrees

10 hours ago, OrdinaryKerman said:

You need to enable reflections in KSP graphics settings. When you start up KSP, go to settings. Go to the Graphics tab. Set 'reflection refresh' to something other than 0.

Should the FAQ/Known Issues part in the OP be updated? Because this is a very frequently asked question, and it seems clear that the vague 'be sure to turn on shaders in KSP settings' can be confusing.

Thank you so much!! It’s working now, I would update with a small note saying to change that setting because I would never had guessed to do that. Thanks again!

Hey! I have a KSP 1.8.1 install of RO, plus a 1.6.1 install of RO, and two questions. One, will the RO edition ever be updated to a more recent version by @Nessus_, or will it stay on 1.6.1? I know I can probably get it to work in 1.8.1 with the right fiddling, but that might not work and takes longer to do, with my limited knowledge of modding. Two, will it ever get an update altogether? I mean, it was last posted about in 2017, and I don't know if Nessus will go back to that add-on. Just a couple questions from a new forum member

Hey, 

I cant get the Starshi[ fins to work with wasd. The craft files require me to press 5 and 6 to activate pitch, yaw and roll for the flaps but when i press WASD nothing happens. Is this a bug or am i doing something wrong? 

Thanks

Hi,

It seems like there's an issue with Waterfall, possibly related to a recent update to the plugin. The Super Heavy center only engine mode no longer has a plume. When checking the ingame editor, seems like the throttle controller isn't responding to the actual throttle value ingame.

Edit: I seem to have fixed the issue. Inside the Waterfall .cfg for the Super Heavy raptor cluster, inside the CenterOnly block, the Throttle controller needs another "engineID = CenterOnly" for it to function correctly. Looks to be related to the Waterfall plugin changes in the March 9th update - "Moved 'engineID' field inside the Throttle controller".

Edited March 16, 2021 by theon502
what scale is this mode designed to work with?

2 minutes ago, squeaker0704 said:

what scale is this mode designed to work with?  

JNSQ; or 2.7x stock
nice I'm running jnsq at the moment

10 minutes ago, squeaker0704 said:

nice I'm running jnsq at the moment 

Then you should know that a as a rule of thumb, mod balanced against stock parts = best used with JNSQ or some other 2.5-3x size system, because that's the whole point of JNSQ size: for more realistic rocket performance.

On 3/16/2021 at 2:21 PM, theon502 said:

Hi,

It seems like there's an issue with Waterfall, possibly related to a recent update to the plugin. The Super Heavy center only engine mode no longer has a plume. When checking the ingame editor, seems like the throttle controller isn't responding to the actual throttle value ingame.

Edit: I seem to have fixed the issue. Inside the Waterfall .cfg for the Super Heavy raptor cluster, inside the CenterOnly block, the Throttle controller needs another "engineID = CenterOnly" for it to function correctly. Looks to be related to the Waterfall plugin changes in the March 9th update - "Moved 'engineID' field inside the Throttle controller".

On 3/14/2021 at 1:53 AM, DasBear1 said:

Hey so I downloaded the mod yesterday with textures unlimited, but the Starship still wasn’t shiny. Is there a special way I have to install or do to textures unlimited to get it to work?

Go to the main menu > Settings > Graphics > Make sure the Reflection Refresh Mode is on.

Hey! I have a KSP 1.8.1 install of RO, plus a 1.6.1 install of RO, and two questions. One, will the RO edition ever be updated to a more recent version by @Nessus_, or will it stay on 1.6.1? I know I can probably get it to work in 1.8.1 with the right fiddling, but that might not work and takes longer to do, with my limited knowledge of modding. Two, will it ever get an update altogether? I mean, it was last posted about in 2017, and I don't know if Nessus will go back to that add-on. Just a couple questions from a new forum member

RO patches for later KSP versions will come. But with the new Starship design it takes a lot of time to balance it. Nessus is working really hard. I can't give you any timeframe when it will be finished.
